hc.server.ui

Class ClientSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.ui.ClientSession

  • public class ClientSession
extends java.lang.Object
    a ClientSession instance will be created before ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGIN, and will be released by server after ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOGOUT.

    invoking ProjectContext.getClientSession() to get this instance for current session.

    it is thread safe.
    Since:
    7.7

      • getLocationAltitude

        public final double getLocationAltitude()
        returns the last known altitude (unit : meter).
        if no permission (project or mobile) or no GPS signal, then return -1.0;
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLocationLongitude()

      • getLocationCourse

        public final double getLocationCourse()
        returns the last known course.
        -1.0 means unknown (some Android return 0.0).

        0 means north
        90 means east
        180 means south
        270 means west
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLocationLongitude()

      • getLocationLatitude

        public final double getLocationLatitude()
        returns the last known latitude.

        project permission [location of mobile] is required.

        if no permission (project or mobile) or no GPS signal, then return -1.0;

        to set location updates frequency, see ProjectContext.setLocationUpdates(long).
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLocationLongitude(), isWithoutLocation(), ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOCATION, ProjectContext.addSystemEventListener(hc.server.util.SystemEventListener), getLocationAltitude(), getLocationCourse(), getLocationSpeed()

      • getLocationLongitude

        public final double getLocationLongitude()
        returns the last known longitude.

        project permission [location of mobile] is required.

        if no permission (project or mobile) or no GPS signal, then return -1.0;

        to set location updates frequency, see ProjectContext.setLocationUpdates(long).
        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLocationLatitude(), isWithoutLocation(), ProjectContext.EVENT_SYS_MOBILE_LOCATION, ProjectContext.addSystemEventListener(hc.server.util.SystemEventListener), getLocationAltitude(), getLocationCourse(), getLocationSpeed(), isLocationGPS(), isLocationFresh()

      • getLocationSpeed

        public final double getLocationSpeed()
        returns the last known speed (unit : meter/second).
        -1.0 means unknown (some Android return 0.0).

        Returns:
        See Also:
        getLocationLongitude()

      • getMultipleFilesFromClient

        public final java.util.Vector<HCFileInputStream> getMultipleFilesFromClient(java.lang.String type)
        get multiple files from mobile client.

        it is equals with openMultipleFilesFromClient(String).

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        3. in iOS, voice memos can't be accessed.
        Parameters:
        type - file type (recommend, the return file depends on user choice), one of TYPE_IMAGE, TYPE_AUDIO, TYPE_VIDEO and TYPE_ALL.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        See Also:
        getOneFileFromClient(String), getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording(), getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph()

      • getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording

        public final HCFileInputStream getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording()
        get a audio file from mobile client, user can choose recording or not.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        3. in iOS, voice memos can't be accessed.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        Since:
        7.72

      • getOneFileFromClient

        public final HCFileInputStream getOneFileFromClient(java.lang.String type)
        get a file from mobile client.

        it is equals with openOneFileFromClient(String).

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        3. in iOS, voice memos can't be accessed.
        Parameters:
        type - file type (recommend, the return file depends on user choice), one of TYPE_IMAGE, TYPE_AUDIO, TYPE_VIDEO and TYPE_ALL.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        openOneFileFromClient(String), getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording(), getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph(), recordAudioFromClient(), recordAudioWithLocationFromClient(), takePhotographFromClient(), takePhotographWithLocationFromClient(), openMultipleFilesFromClient(String)

      • getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph

        public final HCFileInputStream getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph()
        get a image file from mobile client, user can choose taking photograph or not.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        getOneFileFromClient(String)

      • openMultipleFilesFromClient

        public final java.util.Vector<HCFileInputStream> openMultipleFilesFromClient(java.lang.String type)
        open multiple files from mobile client.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        3. in iOS, voice memos can't be accessed.
        Parameters:
        type - file type (recommend, the return file depends on user choice), one of TYPE_IMAGE, TYPE_AUDIO, TYPE_VIDEO and TYPE_ALL.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        openOneFileFromClient(String), getOneFileFromClient(String), getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording(), getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph()

      • openOneFileFromClient

        public final HCFileInputStream openOneFileFromClient(java.lang.String type)
        open a file from mobile client.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when opening file.
        3. in iOS, voice memos can't be accessed.
        Parameters:
        type - file type (recommend, the return file depends on user choice), one of TYPE_IMAGE, TYPE_AUDIO, TYPE_VIDEO and TYPE_ALL.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get file extension of result, use HCFileInputStream.getFileExtension().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        getOneFileFromClient(String), openMultipleFilesFromClient(String), getOneAudioFileMaybeByRecording(), getOneImageFileMaybeByTakingPhotograph(), recordAudioFromClient(), recordAudioWithLocationFromClient(), takePhotographFromClient(), takePhotographWithLocationFromClient()

      • recordAudioFromClient

        public final HCAudioInputStream recordAudioFromClient()
        record a audio from mobile client.

        for audio format, see HCAudioInputStream.getAudioFormat().
        1. Android client, the audio format is 3gp.
        2. iOS client, the audio format is m4a.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when recording audio.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get audio format, use HCAudioInputStream.getAudioFormat().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        recordAudioWithLocationFromClient()

      • recordAudioWithLocationFromClient

        public final HCAudioInputStream recordAudioWithLocationFromClient()
        record a audio with GPS location from mobile client.

        to get location, see HCAudioInputStream.getAudioLongitude().
        project permission [location of mobile] is NOT required.

        for audio format, see HCAudioInputStream.getAudioFormat().
        1. Android client, the audio format is 3gp.
        2. iOS client, the audio format is m4a.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when recording audio.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        recordAudioFromClient()

      • removeAttribute

        public final java.lang.Object removeAttribute(java.lang.String name)
        removes the attribute with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - the name that needs to be removed
        Returns:
        the attribute to which the name had been mapped, or null if the name did not have a mapping
        Since:
        7.7

      • scanQRCodeFromClient

        public final java.lang.String scanQRCodeFromClient()
        scan QR code on client and wait for result.

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when scanning code.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception.
        Since:
        7.72

      • setAttribute

        public final java.lang.Object setAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                            java.lang.Object obj)
        set an object to a given attribute name.

        it is thread safe.

        to set attribute for project (NOT for session), see ProjectContext.setAttribute(String, Object).
        Parameters:
        name - the name of attribute.
        obj - the value of the attribute.
        Returns:
        the previous object of the specified name, or null if it did not have one
        Since:
        7.7
        See Also:
        setIntAttribute(String, int), setBooleanAttribute(String, boolean), setStringAttribute(String, String)

        value -

      • setByteArrayAttribute

        public final void setByteArrayAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         byte[] value)
        set value for the name in attribute.
        to copy to new byte array , please invoke setByteArrayAttribute(String, byte[], int, int).
        Parameters:
        name -
        value - is NOT copied.

      • setByteArrayAttribute

        public final void setByteArrayAttribute(java.lang.String name,
                         byte[] bs,
                         int offset,
                         int length)
        set name with new byte array, which copy values from bs.
        Parameters:
        name -
        bs - the values is copied to new byte array.
        offset -
        length -
        See Also:
        setByteArrayAttribute(String, byte[])

        value -

      • takePhotographFromClient

        public final HCImageInputStream takePhotographFromClient()
        take a photograph from mobile client.
        for image format, see HCImageInputStream.getImageFormat().

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when taking photograph.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get image format, invoke HCImageInputStream.getImageFormat().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        takePhotographWithLocationFromClient()

      • takePhotographWithLocationFromClient

        public final HCImageInputStream takePhotographWithLocationFromClient()
        take a photograph with GPS location from mobile client.

        to get location, see HCImageInputStream.getImageLongitude().
        project permission [location of mobile] is NOT required.

        for image format, see HCImageInputStream.getImageFormat().

        Know more :
        1. it will block current thread for result, but not block server receiving result.
        2. mobile client will not display alert/question/dialog when taking photograph.
        Returns:
        null means canceled by user or exception, it returns full stream or null, never part.
        To get image format, invoke HCImageInputStream.getImageFormat().
        Since:
        7.72
        See Also:
        takePhotographFromClient()
